stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Russian State-Sponsored Cyber Actors Targeting Network Infrastructure Devices
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS), the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), and the United Kingdomâ€™s National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) are providing information related to the worldwide cyber exploitation of network infrastructure devices (e.g., router, switch, firewall, Network-based Intrusion Detection System (NIDS) devices) by Russian state-sponsored cyber actors.

marking:Marking_Structure.TOUMarking:Terms_Of_Use: DISCLAIMER: This report is provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. The DHS does not endorse any commercial product or service, referenced in this bulletin or otherwise. This document is distributed as TLP:WHITE: Disclosure is not limited. For more information on the Traffic Light Protocol, see http://www.us-cert.gov/tlp.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious IPv4 Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: According to open-source reporting, between June 29 and July 6, 2017, Russian actors used this IP and the Cisco Smart Install protocol over port 4786, to scan for vulnerable network devices on several network ranges.

marking:Marking_Structure.TOUMarking:Terms_Of_Use: DISCLAIMER: This report is provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. The DHS does not endorse any commercial product or service, referenced in this bulletin or otherwise. This document is distributed as TLP:WHITE: Disclosure is not limited. For more information on the Traffic Light Protocol, see http://www.us-cert.gov/tlp.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious IPv4 Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: According to open-source reporting, between June 29 and July 6, 2017, Russian actors used this IP and the Cisco Smart Install protocol over port 4786, to scan for vulnerable network devices on several network ranges.

marking:Marking_Structure.TOUMarking:Terms_Of_Use: DISCLAIMER: This report is provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious IPv4 Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: According to DHS, FBI, and NCSC analysis, since late July 2016, this IP has been scanning thousands of IPs worldwide using SNMP, as part of a worldwide campaign by Russian state-sponsored cyber actors. This IP is also the TFTP server IP parameter for SNMP v2c and v1 set-requests with the OID 1.3.6.1.4.1.9.2.1.55.

marking:Marking_Structure.TOUMarking:Terms_Of_Use: DISCLAIMER: This report is provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. The DHS does not endorse any commercial product or service, referenced in this bulletin or otherwise. This document is distributed as TLP:WHITE: Disclosure is not limited. For more information on the Traffic Light Protocol, see http://www.us-cert.gov/tlp.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious IPv4 Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: According to DHS, FBI, and NCSC analysis, this IP is the TFTP server IP parameter for the SNMP Command ID 1.3.6.1.4.1.9.9.96, and is part of a worldwide campaign by Russian state-sponsored cyber actors.

marking:Marking_Structure.TOUMarking:Terms_Of_Use: DISCLAIMER: This report is provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. The DHS does not endorse any commercial product or service, referenced in this bulletin or otherwise. This document is distributed as TLP:WHITE: Disclosure is not limited. For more information on the Traffic Light Protocol, see http://www.us-cert.gov/tlp.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious IPv4 Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: According to DHS, FBI, and NCSC analysis, SNMP, TFTP, HTTP, Telnet, or SSH traffic was observed being sent to and from this IP, as part of a worldwide campaign by Russian state-sponsored cyber actors.
